meanings.definition: To strike forcefully with a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: He whacks the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She whacks the nail with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef whacks the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm whacks the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher whacks the desk to get the students' attention.

meanings.sent1: The whacks on the door startled her.
meanings.sent2: He felt the whacks of the branches against his skin.
meanings.sent3: The whacks of the drumsticks echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: The boxer received a powerful whacks to the jaw.
meanings.sent5: The whacks of the hammer could be heard from afar.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a sharp sound
meanings.sent1: She whacks the table to get rid of the crumbs.
meanings.sent2: The chef whacks the cutting board with a knife.
meanings.sent3: The cat whacks the toy mouse around the room.
meanings.sent4: The rain whacks against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent5: He whacks the book closed after finishing the last page.
